subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. Today I'd
like to talk a bit
about psychokinetic weather control. Now,
probably every one of you who is a
regular viewer knows about my book The
PK Man, a 10 year study of Ted Owens, a
man who claimed and demonstrated over
and over again the ability to influence
the weather through psychokinesis,
apparently, or telepathic contact with
hyper dimensional entities might be
another explanation. Or even perhaps
precognition, that is to be able to
predict weather and make it seem as if
he was influencing it. Those are the
three alternatives. There are
numerous videos now [in] which I've
discussed this case because it's one of
the most unusual, bizarre cases in the
history of parapsychology and psychical
research. But, I think there's some
updates that some of you who are
interested in this area ought to know
about. One of them actually was referred
to me by a viewer not long ago and it
has to do with a fellow in Indiana named
Michael Grubb, a young man who is some
sort of a metaphysical minister. He
has a number of videos on his own
YouTube channel in which, ostensibly, he
is demonstrating psychokinetic weather
control. It looks quite interesting and
in fact right now I'm linking to one of
those videos. You'll see it in the upper
right hand corner of your screen if you
want to check out Michael Grubb. Well, I
looked at that and I thought it was
really fascinating. In fact, as I recall,
in one of those videos he said the
easiest way to get started in
psychokinetic weather control is just to
try and influence clouds with your mind.
It made sense to me since clouds are
relatively volatile and good PK targets
are exactly that, volatile, like for
example, dice
when they're being thrown. Now, you
may know this. When I took the Ted Owens
training in 1986, he asked me, "What do you
want to do with this?" And I thought to
myself, certainly not what you do. I'm not
interested in controlling the weather,
making lightning strike and things of
that sort. In fact, I thought that was
a little too sensational and scary for me.
I said, "What I want to manifest through
psychokinesis is to become a
communicator to the public-at-large
about these realities of the esoteric
occult in psychic worlds. Within
months of taking that training I
launched the Thinking Allowed channel on
television. This was mainstream
television, it got out over the satellite
and was broadcasted on a weekly basis for
some fifteen years all across North America
on public TV stations. So, that went well
but what I read or listened to Michael
Grubb talking about weather control, well,
one night when I was out looking at the
sky as I love to do from my porch here
in Albuquerque, it was cloudy, it
was a very cloudy day, and I thought well,
why don't I just try it and let's see what I
can do. And at a whim, I did. I saw a cloud
and there were two identical shaped lobes
in the cloud and I thought, well let's
see if I can make one larger and one
smaller, a particular one larger and
a particular one smaller. And you know
what, it took about 10 minutes but that
happened. The one got larger, the other
got smaller. Then, to my astonishment
the lobes changed a little bit and
a third smaller one appeared, so there was
one large lobe in the center, two small
lobes on each side, and it formed the
Greek letters psi, which of course
is the word that parapsychologists use as
a catch-all word for all psychic
phenomena. That impressed me. I have
the feeling that really the atmosphere
was alive, that I was communicating with
some sort of a conscious entity that was
expressing itself through the clouds.
That was my intuition. So, I said
to myself, "Let's try another one." Then
I found a big solid cloudy area and
I said to myself, "Let's see if I can make
a hole right in the middle of it, that
would be impressive. That would be
unusual to me and indicative that this
really was
psychokinesis and not some sort of a
projection from my subconscious mind."
There are various words, pareidolia, or
apophenia, where you project
meaning onto meaningless situations.
That's the risk. I'm aware of the
potential foolishness that this could
lead to, but I did, I concentrated once
again. It took about 10 minutes
of concentration, on and off. But what
happened was that in the cloud I began
to see several holes, like two eyes and
nose and a mouth, a mouth in fact with a
kind of crooked grin with teeth. Then,
as I was watching it the mouth got
larger and larger, the other holes
disappeared and there it was, just as I
had intended, a big hole in the center of
that cloud. Now, it sure seemed to me when
I was looking at that face staring back
at me from the cloud, it
reinforced my idea that there's some
sort of an intelligence expressing
itself through the cloud. The next
day I thought, you know, was that real, did
it really happen? I'll try it again.
Actually, that time I had my
camera and I took a picture and I'm going to show
you. It was a picture of a very distinct
darkish cloud not far from me in the sky.
I thought, I'll see if I can make that
cloud disappear. Sure enough, and you
can see the photographic images that I
took, the cloud disappeared. Then, I
thought to myself, let's see if I can
make it reappear.
Now, something did reappear as a matter
of fact. There's another photo where you
can see kind of wisps of cloud, dark
cloud reappearing right in that spot. But
it didn't reappear to the full strength
of the dark cloud that had originally
been there. As I thought about it,
it dawned on me that the linger effect in
psychokinesis that I've written about in
The Roots of Consciousness, it seems to
work this way. I've also written about it
in The PK Man. That's when you project
a psychokinetic intention, that intention
can linger physically in the area where
it was projected. This was first reported
in some research going back many years.
It was a healing study by Graham Watkinson,
you can read about it in The Roots of
Consciousness. In fact, I'm going to
provide a link right now to the portion
of The Roots of Consciousness that
describes the linger effect. So, that
might be one way of explaining why it is
that the cloud just didn't reappear so
much because the energy of having the
cloud dissipate was still there in the
atmosphere at that location. I call it
energy, maybe a better word would be
intention. Now, interestingly, I posted
something about Michael Grubbs' videos on
one of the parapsychology discussion
lists in which I partake.
In response, I learned to my delight
that there is a graduate student in
atmospheric science at the University of
California at Davis named Dani Caputi.
Dani has prepared an in-depth
proposal to begin a very serious study
of the atmosphere and the interactions
between human intention and atmospheric
effects. Now, I have to say, I read over her
proposal that was presented a few weeks
ago at the conference of the Society for
Scientific Exploration that took place
in Las Vegas, my former hometown, and it's
an elegant proposal. It's very serious and
very well thought out. I'm delighted
to see that she, to some degree, builds
upon the study that I did many years ago
in my book The PK Man. So,
what I'm going to do is also post that
proposal now, if you look in the upper
right, for those of you who are really
serious and want to see how it's
possible to conduct scientific studies
of psychokinetic control of the weather.
Although she doesn't like to think of it
as control, she likes to think of it as
inviting the weather to do things. I
think that may be a good way to think of
it, kind of a relationship, not, I am in
control of the weather, but let's
work in harmony with the weather to see
what we can do. Anyhow, you can
download that paper if you're serious
and would like to read it. But, if not,
because I know you're not all scientists
who are viewing, what does this mean for
you? Well, I can say this. If you're
thinking that you might like to explore
your own psychokinetic abilities, I
would encourage you to pursue the same method
that Michael Grubb
mentions in his video. See what you can
do, concentrating on clouds. Be careful
not to deceive yourself. But, I would be
very happy to hear from viewers who
decide to give it a try. I think this is
a reasonable way to begin to explore
your own psychokinetic potential. So give
it some thought. Once again, thank you
for being with me.
